column2: [Page 442] FRIED WHITEFISH--III
column3: [Page four hundred forty two] FRIED WHITEFISH-three

column2: Clean and dry the fish, cut into fillets, dip in seasoned crumbs, then in egg, then in crumbs, and fry quickly in fat to cover.
column3: Clean and dry the fish, cut into fillets, dip in seasoned crumbs, then in egg, then in crumbs, and fry quickly in fat to cover.

column2: Serve with Tartar Sauce.
column3: Serve with Tartar Sauce.

column2: BROILED WHITEFISH--I
column3: BROILED WHITEFISH-I

column2: Clean, trim, and split a large whitefish, season with salt, pepper, and oil, and broil.
column3: Clean, trim, and split a large whitefish, season with salt, pepper, and oil, and broil.

column2: Garnish with lemon and parsley and serve with Tartar Sauce.
column3: Garnish with lemon and parsley and serve with Tartar Sauce.

column2: BROILED WHITEFISH--II
column3: BROILED WHITEFISH-two

column2: Put a cleaned and split whitefish on a wire broiler, season with salt and cayenne, lay a few thin slices of bacon on top, put the broiler on a baking-pan, and cook in the oven without turning. Put on a platter, add a little butter, and rub hard-boiled eggs through a sieve over the fish.
column3: Put a cleaned and split whitefish on a wire broiler, season with salt and cayenne, lay a few thin slices of bacon on top, put the broiler on a baking pan, and cook in the oven without turning. Put on a platter, add a little butter, and rub hard boiled eggs through a sieve over the fish.

column2: Garnish with parsley and lemon.
column3: Garnish with parsley and lemon.

column2: BROILED WHITEFISH--III
column3: BROILED WHITEFISH-three

column2: Clean and split the fish, season with salt and pepper, sprinkle with lemon-juice, and broil.
column3: Clean and split the fish, season with salt and pepper, sprinkle with lemon juice, and broil.

column2: Pour over melted butter and serve.
column3: Pour over melted butter and serve.

column2: BAKED WHITEFISH--I
column3: BAKED WHITEFISH-I

column2: Clean and split a large fish, remove the bone, and put in a buttered baking-pan skin-side down.
column3: Clean and split a large fish, remove the bone, and put in a buttered baking pan skin side down.

column2: Season with salt, cayenne, and lemon-juice, [Page 443] sprinkle with crumbs, dot with butter, and bake.
column3: Season with salt, cayenne, and lemon juice, [Page four hundred forty three] sprinkle with crumbs, dot with butter, and bake.

column2: Serve with any preferred sauce.
column3: Serve with any preferred sauce.

column2: BAKED WHITEFISH--II
column3: BAKED WHITEFISH-two

column2: Make a stuffing of one and one-half cupfuls of dry bread-crumbs, seasoning with salt and pepper.
column3: Make a stuffing of one and one half cupfuls of dry bread crumbs, seasoning with salt and pepper.

column2: Add a heaping tablespoonful of butter and one egg well-beaten.
column3: Add a heaping tablespoonful of butter and one egg well beaten.

column2: Stuff the fish and sew it up.
column3: Stuff the fish and sew it up.

column2: Put in a buttered baking-pan, pour in one cupful of vinegar, and bake until done, basting with butter and hot water.
column3: Put in a buttered baking pan, pour in one cupful of vinegar, and bake until done, basting with butter and hot water.

column2: Take up the fish and thicken the gravy with two tablespoonfuls of flour browned in butter and rubbed smooth with a little cold water.
column3: Take up the fish and thicken the gravy with two tablespoonfuls of flour browned in butter and rubbed smooth with a little cold water.

column2: BAKED WHITE FISH--III
column3: BAKED WHITE FISH-three

column2: Dip the fillets of whitefish in beaten egg, then in crumbs, then in egg, then in crumbs, and lastly in beaten egg.
column3: Dip the fillets of whitefish in beaten egg, then in crumbs, then in egg, then in crumbs, and lastly in beaten egg.

column2: Bake in a buttered dripping-pan for twenty-five minutes and serve with Cream Sauce.
column3: Bake in a buttered dripping pan for twenty five minutes and serve with Cream Sauce.

column2: BAKED FILLETS OF WHITEFISH
column3: BAKED FILLETS OF WHITEFISH

column2: Cut a large cleaned whitefish into fillets, removing as much as possible of the bone.
column3: Cut a large cleaned whitefish into fillets, removing as much as possible of the bone.

column2: Season with salt and pepper, dip into beaten egg, then in crumbs, then in beaten egg, then in crumbs, and lastly [Page 444] in beaten egg.
column3: Season with salt and pepper, dip into beaten egg, then in crumbs, then in beaten egg, then in crumbs, and lastly [Page four hundred forty four] in beaten egg.

column2: Bake in a thickly buttered baking-dish, drain on brown paper, garnish with fried parsley, and serve with Parsley Sauce.
column3: Bake in a thickly buttered baking dish, drain on brown paper, garnish with fried parsley, and serve with Parsley Sauce.

column2: BAKED WHITEFISH A LA BORDEAUX
column3: BAKED WHITEFISH A l a BORDEAUX

column2: Stuff a large whitefish with seasoned crumbs, put into a buttered baking-pan, rub with butter, dredge with seasoned flour, add one cupful of Claret, and bake.
column3: Stuff a large whitefish with seasoned crumbs, put into a buttered baking pan, rub with butter, dredge with seasoned flour, add one cupful of Claret, and bake.

column2: Take up the fish, strain the liquid, add a little more Claret, thicken with flour, brown in butter, season with red pepper, and serve separately.
column3: Take up the fish, strain the liquid, add a little more Claret, thicken with flour, brown in butter, season with red pepper, and serve separately.

column2: STUFFED WHITEFISH
column3: STUFFED WHITEFISH

column2: Make a stuffing of bread-crumbs, seasoning with salt, pepper, sweet herbs, and melted butter.
column3: Make a stuffing of bread crumbs, seasoning with salt, pepper, sweet herbs, and melted butter.

column2: Add a beaten egg to bind, stuff the fish, and sew up.
column3: Add a beaten egg to bind, stuff the fish, and sew up.

column2: Bake slowly, basting with melted butter and water, and serve with Tartar Sauce.
column3: Bake slowly, basting with melted butter and water, and serve with Tartar Sauce.

column2: STUFFED WHITEFISH WITH OYSTER SAUCE
column3: STUFFED WHITEFISH WITH OYSTER SAUCE

column2: Make a stuffing of two cupfuls of bread-crumbs, half a cupful of chopped salt pork fried crisp, a chopped hard-boiled egg, half a cupful of vinegar, and salt, pepper, butter, sage, and mustard to season.
column3: Make a stuffing of two cupfuls of bread crumbs, half a cupful of chopped salt pork fried crisp, a chopped hard boiled egg, half a cupful of vinegar, and salt, pepper, butter, sage, and mustard to season.

column2: Stuff the fish, tie in mosquito netting, and steam until [Page 445] done.
column3: Stuff the fish, tie in mosquito netting, and steam until [Page four hundred forty five] done.

column2: Pour over a Cream Sauce to which cooked oysters and a little lemon-juice and minced parsley have been added.
column3: Pour over a Cream Sauce to which cooked oysters and a little lemon juice and minced parsley have been added.

column2: WHITEFISH A LA CREME--I
column3: WHITEFISH A l a CREME-I

column2: Cook the fish until done in boiling salted water, drain, and remove the large bones.
column3: Cook the fish until done in boiling salted water, drain, and remove the large bones.

column2: Cook together two tablespoonfuls each of butter and flour, add two cupfuls of milk, and cook until thick, stirring constantly.
column3: Cook together two tablespoonfuls each of butter and flour, add two cupfuls of milk, and cook until thick, stirring constantly.

column2: Season with salt, pepper, grated onion, minced parsley, and grated nutmeg, take from the fire and add half a cupful of butter.
column3: Season with salt, pepper, grated onion, minced parsley, and grated nutmeg, take from the fire and add half a cupful of butter.

column2: Add also the white of an egg well-beaten.
column3: Add also the white of an egg well beaten.

column2: Put the fish on a serving-dish, spread the sauce over it and brown in the oven.
column3: Put the fish on a serving dish, spread the sauce over it and brown in the oven.

column2: WHITEFISH A LA CREME--II
column3: WHITEFISH A l a CREME-two

column2: Clean a whitefish and simmer until done in salted, boiling water. Drain, remove the large bones.
column3: Clean a whitefish and simmer until done in salted, boiling water. Drain, remove the large bones.

column2: Put into a buttered baking-pan, sprinkle with chopped onion and minced parsley, seasoning with grated nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
column3: Put into a buttered baking pan, sprinkle with chopped onion and minced parsley, seasoning with grated nutmeg, salt, and pepper.

column2: Cover with Cream Sauce to which three tablespoonfuls of butter have been added, and put into a hot oven for ten or fifteen minutes.
column3: Cover with Cream Sauce to which three tablespoonfuls of butter have been added, and put into a hot oven for ten or fifteen minutes.

column2: [Page 446] WHITEFISH AU GRATIN--I
column3: [Page four hundred forty six] WHITEFISH AU GRATIN-I

column2: Boil a whitefish in salted water and flake fine with a fork.
column3: Boil a whitefish in salted water and flake fine with a fork.

column2: Bring to the boil two cupfuls of milk and thicken it with a tablespoonful of corn-starch rubbed smooth in a little cold water.
column3: Bring to the boil two cupfuls of milk and thicken it with a tablespoonful of corn starch rubbed smooth in a little cold water.

column2: Take from the fire, add salt and pepper to season, two tablespoonfuls of butter, and two eggs well-beaten.
column3: Take from the fire, add salt and pepper to season, two tablespoonfuls of butter, and two eggs well beaten.

column2: Butter a baking-dish, put in a layer of fish, cover with sauce, season with grated nutmeg, and repeat until the dish is full.
column3: Butter a baking dish, put in a layer of fish, cover with sauce, season with grated nutmeg, and repeat until the dish is full.

column2: Cover with crumbs, dot with butter, and brown in the oven.
column3: Cover with crumbs, dot with butter, and brown in the oven.

column2: WHITEFISH AU GRATIN--II
column3: WHITEFISH AU GRATIN-two

column2: Skin and bone the fish, cut into small squares, and season with salt and pepper.
column3: Skin and bone the fish, cut into small squares, and season with salt and pepper.

column2: Brown two tablespoonfuls of flour in butter, and add gradually two cupfuls of stock or milk.
column3: Brown two tablespoonfuls of flour in butter, and add gradually two cupfuls of stock or milk.

column2: Cook until thick, stirring constantly, seasoning with salt, pepper, lemon-juice, minced parsley, grated onion, and a tablespoonful of vinegar.
column3: Cook until thick, stirring constantly, seasoning with salt, pepper, lemon juice, minced parsley, grated onion, and a tablespoonful of vinegar.

column2: Butter a baking-dish, put in a layer of the fish, cover with sauce, and repeat until the dish is full.
column3: Butter a baking dish, put in a layer of the fish, cover with sauce, and repeat until the dish is full.

column2: Cover with crumbs, dot with butter, and brown in the oven.
column3: Cover with crumbs, dot with butter, and brown in the oven.

column2: WHITEFISH A LA MAITRE D'HOTEL
column3: WHITEFISH A l a MAITRE D'HOTEL

column2: Clean, split, and bone a large whitefish, dip in seasoned oil, broil, [Page 447] and serve with Maitre d'Hotel Sauce.
column3: Clean, split, and bone a large whitefish, dip in seasoned oil, broil, [Page four hundred forty seven] and serve with Maitre d'Hotel Sauce.

column2: WHITEFISH A LA POINT SHIRLEY
column3: WHITEFISH A l a POINT SHIRLEY

column2: Clean, split, and bone the fish, and put into a buttered baking-pan, skin-side down.
column3: Clean, split, and bone the fish, and put into a buttered baking pan, skin side down.

column2: Season with salt, red pepper, and lemon-juice, add enough boiling water to keep from burning, and bake.
column3: Season with salt, red pepper, and lemon juice, add enough boiling water to keep from burning, and bake.

column2: Serve with Maitre d'Hotel Sauce.
column3: Serve with Maitre d'Hotel Sauce.

column2: PLANKED WHITEFISH--I
column3: PLANKED WHITEFISH-I

column2: Butter a fish-plank and tack a large cleaned and split whitefish on it, skin side down.
column3: Butter a fish plank and tack a large cleaned and split whitefish on it, skin side down.

column2: Rub with butter, season with salt and pepper, and cook in the oven or under a gas flame.
column3: Rub with butter, season with salt and pepper, and cook in the oven or under a gas flame.

column2: Put a border of mashed potato mixed with the beaten white of egg around the fish, using a pastry tube and forcing bag.
column3: Put a border of mashed potato mixed with the beaten white of egg around the fish, using a pastry tube and forcing bag.

column2: Put into the oven for a few minutes to brown the potato, and serve with a garnish of lemon and parsley.
column3: Put into the oven for a few minutes to brown the potato, and serve with a garnish of lemon and parsley.
